user_query: forever, he finally finds a hardware store. But they don't carry batteries that fit his game. While Grandma is searching for her missing hairpin... Sang-woo considers trading it for snacks instead. But the store owner scolds him harshly, and he runs away in a panic. Soon, he's lost and crying. Thankfully, an old man passing by gives him a ride back near home. Sang-woo realizes the world doesn't always go your way… But sometimes, there are kind people who help you when things get hard. And someone who always shows that kindness, no matter what— Grandma. "Where are you going?" This time, it's Sang-woo who leads the way home. He lies on the wooden floor, lost in thought. Little by little… ever so slowly... Sang-woo's heart is beginning to grow. The sound of the rain starts to echo inside him. He doesn't know why—but the moment feels unsettling as the laundry gets drenched. So he brings it in. The rain stops almost as soon as it began, before his hair even dries. He hangs the laundry back out again. It's the first time he's helped with chores. Maybe he feels a bit shy, arranging things as if nothing happened. But Grandma notices what he did in the rain. She gently touches his forehead. She wants to reward her sweet boy with something tasty. "What?" "You don't have any money…" "Pizza, hamburger, Kentucky Chicken…" "You don't even know what that is." "Look! Kentucky Chicken!" "Yes, yes. Bok bok! Chicken!" Grandma sets off, carrying wild ferns to trade for chicken. "Come back

entities.entity_description: 상우는 할머니와 함께 지내는 어린 소년으로, 처음에는 도시 생활에 익숙했지만 점차 마음이 성장하며 할머니를 돕기 시작하는 인물이다
할머니는 상우를 돌보는 인물로, 말없이 손자에게 한결같은 사랑과 친절을 베푸는 캐릭터이다
노인은 길을 잃고 울고 있던 상우를 집 근처까지 태워다 준 친절한 행인이다
가게 주인은 상우를 호되게 꾸짖어 그가 도망치게 만든 인물이다

relationships.relationship_description: 상우는 할머니의 손자이며 할머니의 보살핌을 받고 있다
노인은 길을 잃은 상우를 집 근처까지 태워다 주었다
가게 주인이 상우를 꾸짖어서 상우가 도망쳤다
상우가 비 오는 날 빨래를 걷어주며 처음으로 집안일을 도왔고, 할머니는 이를 알아채고 보답하려 한다
